content:
Different arithmetic operations can be used with `int`(#e7e8ea) and `double`(#e7e8ea) data types.

- `+`(#e7e8ea) addition
- `-`(#e7e8ea) subtraction
- `*`(#e7e8ea) multiplication
- `/`(#e7e8ea) division
- `%`(#e7e8ea) modulo (gets the remainder)

Dividing two `int`(#e7e8ea) values will result in an `int`(#e7e8ea) value. The decimal portion is truncated, or cut off from the end.

```
int x = 8;
int y = 3;
int z = x / y;
```
The value of z is `2`(#e7e8ea).
